DataElement.preferredName: Person Ejection Fraction Lower Limit of Normal Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a person has an ejection fraction, a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction, that is lower than the defined limit of normal as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Ejection Fraction Lower Limit of Normal Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having an ejection fraction, a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction, that is lower than the defined limit of normal as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Ejection Fraction Lower Limit of Normal Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.

The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to lower limit of normal (LLN) by ECHO?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study left ventricular
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) by ECHO or MUGA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has been assigned to receive trametinib or everolimus, is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) within institutional limits of normal (by ECHO or MUGA)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is at increased risk for cardiac toxicities due to any of the risk factors noted below, is LVEF by Echocardiogram greater than institution's lower limit of normal (or 55% if threshold for normal not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines) obtained within 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) within 5 absolute percentage points of institutional standard of normal as measured by echocardiogram (ECHO) or multiple gated acquisition scan (MUGA) within 4 weeks prior to first study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has any of the following risk factors, is LVEF documented by Echocardiogram greater than institution's lower limit of normal (or 55% if threshold for normal not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines) obtained within 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is at increased risk for cardiac toxicities due to any of the risk factors noted below, is LVEF by Echocardiogram greater than institution's lower limit of normal (or 55% if threshold for normal not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines) obtained within 3 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is at increased risk for cardiac toxicities due to any of the risk factors noted below, is LVEF by echocardiogram greater than institution's lower limit of normal (or 55% if threshold for normal not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines) obtained within 3 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) by ECHO?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Left ventricular ejection fraction greater than 45% or the institutional lower limit of normal by either ECHO or MUGA at entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study LVEF greater than or equal to 45%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) by either MUGA or ECHO less than lower limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) by ECHO or MUGA within 30 days of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 45% confirmed by echocardiogram or MUGA, AND patient has no symptoms of congestive heart failure exceeding NYHA Class II?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a left ventricular ejection fraction less than 40% as assessed by a transthoracic echocardiogram or radionuclide angiography within one month prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc using Fredericia's formula [QTcF]) greater than 470 msec (Fridericia's Criteria for Corrected QT interval [QTc]?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Arm 3, is Left ventricular ejection fraction greater than 50% or the institutional lower limit of normal by ECHO at entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than the lower limit of normal (LLN) as assessed by either multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan or echocardiogram (ECHO)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to lower limit of normal (LLN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study cardiac ejection fraction greater than or equal to the institutional lower limit of normal (LLN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50% by echocardiogram or Multigated Acquisition Scan (MUGA)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to the lower limit of normal by ECHO at entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50% by either an echocardiogram (ECHO) or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan or cardiac MRI within 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50% as assessed by echocardiogram or radionuclide angiography?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has history of known congestive heart failure (left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than 50%), does patient have documented LVEF greater than or equal to 50% within 12 months of study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study ejection fraction greater than or equal to 53% on ECHO or cardiac MRI within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study Left Ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is LVEF greater than or equal to 50% within 28 days before enrollment (study drug treatment) by either an echocardiogram (ECHO) or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate cardiac systolic function as measured by ejection fraction (EF) greater than or equal to 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to 50% by either an echocardiogram (ECHO) or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan within 28 days before randomization/enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to 50% or greater than or equal to institutional lower limit of normal by ECHO?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) (or above 50%, whichever is higher) by ECHO or MUGA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study ejection fraction greater than or equal to 50% (or greater than or equal to 45% if no evidence of CHF or other cardiac symptoms) by transthoracic echocardiogram (TTE) or multi-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan?

DataElement.administrativeNotes:
7/21/23 removed special text from AQT_mmt
7/20/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT.wz
